page.title: 10Lt.Kimble Union Free Church
page.content: The average number of people each Sunday is about 15 to 20 .It has pipes which are plugged into the electricity so that it is kept warm .It is very small.Every Tuesday there is a Girls Brigade.It starts at half past 6 and ends at eight oÂ£clock.Captain and Lefty are in charge.There is a kitchen as well.The Church decided to seek new premises and bought this site from the Earl of Buckingham for 7 pounds 10 pence in 1915.The cost of the building without the organ and pews was 2000 pounds.When finished the Church was opened on 9th. July 1923 by Dame Margaret Lloyd George in the presence of 500 people.It has not got any bells.
